page.title: 20THE FUTURE OUTLOOK
page.content: The features of Overy Staithe, the Creek and the Marshes are in a period of change. Our own society moves on rapidly with new development while nature moves in its own mysterious way. How much does Science affect Nature? If pollution kills off the marram grass then the sands move and winds and waves have no opposition as they strike our exposed coast. One flood will ruin valuable marsh and farm land. The local authorities work hard to strengthen our sea defences in order to preserve the marvellous history and heritage of Overy Staithe and Holkham. Alas many houses are sold as holiday homes and the residents become fewer. The villages are in danger of becoming ghost areas in winter. Young families move away in search of work. This area needs young people to settle and create jobs
